tourName: Nine day wildlife safari, South Africa
placesVisited: Rukiya Safari Camp, Unique 'bush senses' experience, Bush walks, Help Ingwe Leopard Research Team set camera traps, Wild Rivers Reserve, Private concession in Balule Reserve, Klaserie Game Reserve, Thornybush Game Reserve
generalInfo:
This exciting 9-day safari visits a variety of private game reserves in the greater Kruger Park area, as well as the world-renowned Kruger National Park. The base for this safari is in Wild Rivers Nature Reserve, but this holiday also takes in Klaserie and Thornybush game reserves, which all offer different accommodation and habitat types, for a fully rounded safari experience. This package includes an introduction to learn more about of work in Leopard conservation, plus even more chances to view the Big Five and explore the African bush. It’s the perfect combination of exploring the African bush, learning about our conservation work and enjoying high quality accommodation in fantastic locations.

We are a small company and prefer small groups of less than eight persons, which allow us to deliver a personal service, with flexibility to cater for any specific needs. Whether you’re here for general wildlife viewing or interested in something specific we can help. In addition, you might like to visit one of our community projects. Choose to be hands-on or simply sit back and let us take the strain. Whatever you prefer, we’ll do our best to provide. Just let us know what you want from your safari experience and together we can make your time with us truly memorable.

This 9-day safari runs all year round and is also available for families. Children under 12 years get 50% off the adult price. Bush walks are replaced by game drives for children under 14 years.

Where possible we provide an all-inclusive price for each safari, with any additions clearly shown on your itinerary. That’s because we understand how important it is to plan your safari costs and avoid any hidden extras.

dayInfo.description: Arrival at Hoedspruit & Welcome to Rukiya Hoedspruit (Eastgate) Airport is the gateway to South Africa’s premier wildlife viewing reserves, with daily flights arriving from Johannesburg and Cape Town. We can arrange your internal flight to Hoedspruit (approximately 50 minutes). Upon landing, you'll be greeted by your On Track Safaris (OTS) representative and transferred to Rukiya Safari Camp. Keep an eye out as you drive past game fences—your first wildlife sightings may happen before you even unpack! No matter how you arrive, you'll reach Rukiya Safari Camp in time to settle in, unwind, and enjoy the tranquil surroundings. You’ll also receive a reusable On Track Safaris metal water bottle to help reduce plastic use during your stay, along with a spoor card to help identify animal tracks during game drives and bush walks—be sure to keep it handy! Rukiya is a small, luxury eco-tented camp nestled along the banks of the year-round Blyde River, shaded by towering trees. It’s also an important location for our leopard research, making your visit part of a meaningful conservation effort. Depending on your arrival time, lunch will be served, followed by an optional afternoon drive through the Wild Rivers Reserve. Don’t forget to order your sundowner drinks for the perfect end to your first day. At Rukiya, you’ll receive a complimentary camera trap (one per couple or single guest) as a gift from On Track Safaris. On your first day, with guidance from our expert team, you’ll choose a location on the reserve where you believe leopards and other wildlife may pass. These motion-sensitive devices capture photos or short videos of animals—day or night—offering a thrilling glimpse into their natural behaviour. Camera Trap Challenge Capturing Africa’s wildlife with a camera trap is both exciting and deeply rewarding. Begin by selecting a location frequented by animals—such as watering holes, game trails, or mineral licks—where wildlife naturally congregates. While our guides are there to assist, the final choice is yours. Your camera will be securely mounted to a tree or post at animal height and angled slightly downward for optimal shots. Equipped with infrared technology, it operates silently to avoid disturbing nocturnal creatures. The camera will run continuously throughout your stay, capturing candid moments of Africa’s untamed beauty. These will be checked before departing Rukiya. After dinner at the lodge, you’ll likely retire early to your tent, ready for your first early morning rise and the adventures ahead.

A Day at Rukiya Safari Camp Your days at Rukiya begin with a gentle wake-up call, accompanied by a warm drink and traditional rusks (local biscuits) to start your morning. You'll then set off on a morning game drive through the Wild Rivers Reserve and into the adjacent Balule Reserve, part of the Greater Kruger National Park. This marks your first adventure in a 'Big5' Reserve. These drives may extend longer than usual, often including a bush breakfast served in the wild, before returning to the lodge in the late morning. Lunch is served at the lodge, followed by time to unwind and take in the tranquil views from your private deck. Bush Senses Experience During your stay, you'll have the chance to participate in our unique Bush Senses activity—a short guided walk paired with a sensory exercise developed over many years. This popular experience encourages you to engage all your senses in the bush: not just sight, but also smell, hearing, and touch. In a world where modern living dulls our natural instincts, this simple and fun activity helps sharpen your awareness—perfect preparation for any safari. Conservation & Camera Trap Check You’ll also be invited to attend a fascinating presentation by the Ingwe Leopard Research Team, offering insight into the vital conservation work happening right on the reserve. In the afternoon, your PM drive will explore the Wild Rivers Reserve, possibly passing by your camera trap to ensure it’s still in place. Curious hyenas and baboons are known to tamper with these devices—sometimes even taking selfies before abandoning them in the bush. The resulting photos are often hilarious and a highlight of the trip. Evening at the Lodge After your afternoon adventure, dinner will be served at the lodge, offering a chance to reflect on the day’s sightings and stories under the African sky.

Meet the Anti-Poaching Dog Unit & Visit a Community Project Today offers a well-earned break from early morning game drives, allowing you to enjoy a leisurely start before breakfast. Afterward, you'll embark on a meaningful day excursion, beginning with a visit to the K9 Conservation Group, followed by lunch and an afternoon at Zingela Ulwazi, a local community initiative. K9 Conservation Group The K9 Conservation Group provides vital anti-poaching support to privately owned conservation areas and game reserves through the deployment of elite, highly trained working dog units. You'll meet some of the dedicated rangers and their remarkable canine partners, and learn about the critical role they play in protecting wildlife. A highlight of the visit includes heading into the nearby bush for a live demonstration. Watch as the dogs expertly locate poachers’ snares and track human scent—an eye-opening experience that showcases their incredible skills and intelligence. They’re not only impressive but also a joy to be around. After the demonstration, enjoy lunch at a local café (at your own expense). Zingela Ulwazi Community Project In the afternoon, you'll visit Zingela Ulwazi, a grassroots non-profit focused on empowering rural women through sustainable farming, self-defense training, and community upliftment. During your visit, you’ll explore their inspiring projects, meet the women leading change, and see firsthand how small initiatives can make a big impact. To end the visit, we’ll stop by a lively community hub where children gather after school. You’ll have the opportunity to help serve lunch and share in the warmth of their daily routine—a heartwarming experience that connects you to the spirit of the community. Return via Hoedspruit On your way back to Rukiya, we’ll pass through the charming town of Hoedspruit, where you can opt to stop for a bit of shopping or continue directly to the lodge, arriving in the late afternoon. Dinner will be served in the evening, rounding off a day filled with purpose, connection, and unforgettable encounters.

You'll then set off on a morning game drive through the Wild Rivers Reserve and into the adjacent Balule Reserve, part of the Greater Kruger National Park. This marks your first adventure in a 'Big5' Reserve. These drives may extend longer than usual, often including a bush breakfast served in the wild, before returning to the lodge in the late morning. Lunch is served at the lodge, followed by time to unwind and take in the tranquil views from your private deck. Camera Trap Review & Riverside Relaxation On your return from the morning game drive you'll collect your camera trap and return to the lodge, where—assisted by your guides—you’ll review the photographs it captured. You're welcome to download any images you’d like to keep. If you’ve managed to photograph a leopard, those images will be added to the Ingwe Research Program database, contributing to our ongoing conservation efforts. You’ll also have the option to donate your camera trap to support further research, or—as many guests choose—take it home to continue your wildlife photography adventures. Afternoon Leisure After lunch, enjoy some well-deserved downtime. Grab a cooler box with refreshing drinks and head to our outdoor lounger area along the riverbank. It’s the perfect spot to soak in the peace and quiet of this serene setting, watch birds flitting through the trees, and perhaps spot a hippo or crocodile basking on the opposite bank. Evening Dining Dinner will be served in the evening, rounding off a day of discovery and relaxation in the heart of the bush.

Transfer to Nzumba, Klaserie Game Reserve After a leisurely breakfast and check-out, your vehicle will arrive to transfer you to Nzumba Lodge, located within the renowned Klaserie Game Reserve—a destination celebrated for its exceptional Big Five sightings and premium wildlife experiences. As you travel through the reserve, keep your eyes open for wildlife along the way. Upon arrival at the lodge, you'll be welcomed with a refreshing drink and complete a brief indemnity form. You’ll then have time to settle in, unwind, and enjoy the tranquil surroundings before afternoon high tea is served. Afternoon & Evening Game Drive Later in the day, you'll head out on an afternoon game drive, pausing for sundowner drinks as the sun dips below the horizon. Once darkness falls, your guide will use a spotlight to help you seek out nocturnal animals—a thrilling opportunity to witness the bush come alive after sunset. You’ll return to the lodge for a delicious dinner, rounding off your first evening in Klaserie with stories and sightings from the wild.

Safari Days at Klaserie Game Reserve No two days on safari are ever the same—and your next two days in Klaserie Game Reserve promise fresh discoveries and unforgettable moments. Each morning begins with an early game drive, offering prime opportunities to spot wildlife in the cool hours of the day. You'll return to the lodge in time for a hearty breakfast, followed by a chance to rest and relax during the midday heat. It’s the perfect time to unwind and watch animals wander past from the comfort of the lodge. In the afternoon, after high tea, you'll head out on another game drive, exploring new and previously unseen areas of the reserve. As the sun sets, you’ll pause for sundowner drinks, then continue your drive into the evening, when nocturnal creatures begin to stir. Dinner is often served around the fire in the outdoor boma, under a canopy of stars—a fitting end to a day immersed in the wild.

?? Final Morning in Klaserie On your last morning in Klaserie Game Reserve, you'll set out on a final game drive, exploring areas of the concession not yet visited. It’s a chance to capture those last memorable photographs and soak in the beauty of the bush one more time before returning to the lodge for breakfast. Departure & Transfer After breakfast, your On Track Safaris (OTS) representative will collect you for your transfer to Hoedspruit Airport(approximately 90 minutes). You’ll arrive in time to check in for your departure flight, marking the end of your unforgettable safari adventure.
